page.title: 18Going to School, N. Alcester
page.content: Families living in any of the 3 villages in the area have to make a variety of arrangements for children attending state schools. Great Alne and Coughton each have their own primary school, whilst young children in King's Coughton have to attend school in Coughton or Alcester. The 3 villages are in the catchment area of Alcester Grammar School, so the children have to sit an "11 plus" exam. Some children are selected for the grammar school, whereas the parents of the rest have to choose a high school, the nearest being situated in Alcester and Studley. Some village children have to travel to school much further than others. When distance is too great for walking or cycling, most children are "ferried" by parents with cars.
